content: Is there anything in Thunderbird's logs that could suggest what's going wrong?
creator: bbonacci

content:
A followup... I cleared the "startup cache", Thunderbird restarted; and this time upon trying, it did the same thing as in the third paragraph above.

The "thing that went wrong" is a Google screen that says:

400. That's an error.

The server cannot process the request because it is malformed. It should not be retried. That's all we know.
creator: Vance32768

content:
I really do not know what sort of "support" your think someone can offer you. You do not want one of the new accounts Thunderbird can offer you via mailfence. You do not want a domain of your choosing, subject to availability from gandi. This provider does not even offer gandi email addresses. So you have already exhausted the options of offer.

So I must assume you want something free that you are pointed to because you dislike search engines, otherwise you would already have explored the dozen or so free options google offers when queried.

Perhaps try GMX.com That is simple. OR even email.fr or mail.fr or mail.com also simple. Then there is AOL.com another quite simple and well known provider. I am sure there are others, but a t-bird. anything address is not something that Thunderbird provides
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
[en] All old versions of Thunderbird are in this archive: https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/

[fr] Toutes les anciennes versions de Thunderbird se trouvent dans cette archive : https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/
creator: @next

content:
If you're certain there is no mail to be kept in the old account it can be deleted.

Press Alt or F10 in case the menu bar is hidden. From the main menu bar: Tools - Account Settings Select the account to be deleted in the left pane. Select 'Remove Account' from the 'Account Action' drop-down menu at the bottom.
creator: christ1

content: Se il server non te la fa cancellare, non c'è molto che si possa fare. Prova ad accedere dalla webmail e a cancellarla da lì.
creator: @next

content:
My suggestion is to download from the official site at https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/

- on old PC, be sure to copy the ...appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder after shutting TB down. Otherwise, you get an incomplete copy

- Then, uninstall the MS version on new PC, and install the new version and then shut TB down. - Now, copy the saved thunderbird folder to the ...appdata\roaming folder - Restart TB and I think it will be okay.
creator: davidsk

content: Forgot to say: The server space is 2GB and I'm only using 425MB of it at the moment.
